# Azure Docs

## Configure your development environment

- [Create an Azure account](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/azure/create-azure-account.md): To use Azure, you need an Azure account.  This article covers the three most common ways to sign up for an Azure account.
- [Configure Visual Studio for Azure development (Windows)](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/azure/configure-visual-studio.md): This article helps you configure Visual Studio for Azure development including getting the right workloads installed and connecting Visual Studio to your Azure account.
- [Configure VS Code for Azure development (cross-platform)](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/azure/configure-vs-code.md): This article helps you configure Visual Studio Code for Azure development including getting the right plugins installed and configured in VS Code
- [Install the Azure CLI](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/azure/install-azure-cli.md): Azure developers will need the Azure CLI installed, so this article describes why you need the CLI and where to download and install it from.
- [Install additional tools](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/azure/azure-tools.md): This article describes additional tools and utilities for working with Azure and how you can install them.
- [Development setup checklist](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/azure/dotnet-dev-env-checklist.md): Provides a quick summary of all the tools you should have installed to do .NET development with Azure

## Get started on Azure with .NET

- [Introduction to Azure and .NET](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/azure/intro.md): Learn the basics you need to know about Azure and .NET.
- [Key Azure services for .NET developers](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/azure/key-azure-services.md): Azure has over 100 services, but this article focuses on the ~8 or so services used by .NET developers most frequently

## Children

- [Migration](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/azure/migration/llms.txt)
- [SDK](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/azure/sdk/llms.txt)
